newsitem.title: USA: Kmart says Floto to leave for other firm.
newsitem.headline: Kmart says Floto to leave for other firm.

text.p: Kmart Corp. said Tuesday that Ronald Floto will resign as executive vice president of the parent company and president of Super Kmart Centres as of May 5.
Floto has accepted a job with an unidentified international company, Kmart said.
On an interim basis, the Super Kmart division will report directly to Kmart Chairman, President and Chief Executive Floyd Hall.
Ernest Heether, senior vice president, merchandise planning and replenishment, will assume duties for Kmart's distribution centres which also reported to Floto.
Floto joined Kmart in October 1994 after serving as chairman, chief executive and president of Kash n' Karry Food Stores Inc.
Kmart, based in Troy, Mich., operates 2,036 Kmart stores and 97 Super Kmart Centres.
Its stock was unchanged at $12.875 early on the New York Stock Exchange.
